articles.description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday started livestreaming of hearings.  The apex court had on Monday said it would have its own 'platform' to live-stream proceedings and the use of YouTube for the purpose was temporary. In a unanimous decision, the court decided to live-stream proceedings of all constitution bench hearings, almost four years after a path-breaking verdict in this regard was delivered in 2018.​​
articles.title: Supreme Court begins livestreaming of hearings on YouTube, to have own platform soon

articles.description: In another major crackdown on the Popular Front of India (PFI), police along with other investigative agencies conducted raids across several states on Tuesday. The raids are under way in Assam, Karnataka, Madhya Pradesh, Delhi, Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh. Earlier this week, over 106 members of PFI were arrested by the NIA and the ED for allegedly supporting terror activities in the country.
articles.title: Second round of NIA raids on PFI under way across India: Latest developments

articles.description: The death toll in the country has reached 5,28,562. The 32 deaths reported in the last 24 hours also include 22 deaths reconciled by Kerala. The active Covid cases in the country saw a slight decline and settled at 42,358. Currently active cases comprise of 0.10 per cent of total cases.
articles.title: India reports 3,230 Covid cases, lowest in over 3 months

articles.description: The houses of PFI leaders in various parts of Udupi district were raided by the police on Tuesday and four people were taken into custody in connection with various cases. Four PFI leaders have been taken into custody, police sources said. The raids were conducted at Hoode, Gangolli and Byndoor in the district.
articles.title: PFI leaders' houses raided in Udupi

articles.description: India News: GUWAHATI (ASSAM): The Assam Police on Tuesday launched another operation against the Popular Front of India (PFI) in various districts of the state.
articles.title: Assam Police launches operation against PFI, detains several people

articles.description: PM Modi, who is here to attend the state funeral of Abe, met Kishida ahead of the ceremony and the two leaders renewed their commitment towards further strengthening the India-Japan special strategic and global partnership, and in working together in the region and in various international groupings and institutions.
articles.title: PM Narendra Modi meets Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida

articles.description: Four activists of the Popular Front of India (PFI) were arrested from Kottayam on Monday for breaking the glass of a bakery and damaging a KSRTC bus, police said. From Kollam, a PFI activist was arrested on Monday for allegedly ramming into a police motorbike with his two-wheeler in his bid to escape the clutches of the police personnel. The officers on the bike were seriously injured, police said.
articles.title: 5 PFI activists arrested from Kerala for violent activities during state-wide hartal on September 23

articles.description: Sonia Gandhi is reportedly 'upset' over the Rajasthan developments as Ashok Gehlot was being considered as her successor for the top post. Sources said Gehlot told the two observers that he is not behind the Jaipur development and the MLAs involved in it were not listening to him. Mallikarjun Kharge and Ajay Maken are likely to submit their report to Sonia about the crisis by Wednesday.
articles.title: Jaipur rebellion puts question mark on Ashok Gehlot running for Congress chief's post

articles.description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) was conducting raids in over eight states and at multiple locations linked to the Popular Front of India (PFI) members on Tuesday. Sources said that more than 50 people have been detained and the arrests will depend on their questioning.
articles.title: NIA conducts pan-India raids against PFI, 50 detained

articles.description: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) is conducting raids at the premises of Popular Front of India (PFI) members at multiple locations in western Uttar Pradesh, including Bulandshahr and Meerut, on Tuesday. The raids started early Tuesday morning and are currently underway. NIA sources said that a number of people have already been detained in connection.
articles.title: NIA conducts raids in western UP over PFI links

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: The live-streaming of Supreme Court proceedings will begin from today.
articles.title: Explainer: Now, you can watch Supreme Court live

articles.description: Modi, who is here to attend the state funeral of former Japanese prime minister Shinzo Abe, met his Japanese counterpart ahead of the ceremony.
articles.title: PM Narendra Modi meets Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida

articles.description: "We don't view our relationship with Pakistan, and on the other hand, we don't view our relationship with India as in relation to one another. These are both partners of ours with different points of emphasis in each," state department spokesperson Ned Price told reporters at his daily news conference.
articles.title: What US said on Jaishankar's 'you're not fooling anybody' remark over F-16 sustenance package

articles.description: India News: Though a bench of Justices DY Chandrachud and Hima Kohli was initially reluctant to entertain the PIL filed by an NGO, saying the governments advertis.
articles.title: SC to hear plea on state govts taking out ads in other states

articles.description: Seven tourists from Delhi and UP were killed and 10 more were injured after their bus skidded off the road and fell into a gorge near Jalori Jot in Kullu's Banjar area of Himachal Pradesh around 9pm Sunday. The accident brought back into focus the dangers of nightly travel on winding Himalayan roads, especially in the wet season.
articles.title: 7 Delhi, UP tourists killed as bus skids, falls into gorge in Kullu

articles.description: Union home and cooperation minister Amit Shah said on Monday that Congress had attempted to stall the Narmada project since 1964 but the efforts of Narendra Modi as Gujarat CM ensured rapid progress of the project.
articles.title: Congress had stalled Narmada project since 1964: Amit Shah

articles.description: The government on Monday told Russia that the two countries can collaborate which include development of 5G use cases, design 6G technology, internet of things (IoT), cyber security and developing reliable last mile solution.
articles.title: 5G across India in a few yrs: Mantri

articles.description: Two weeks after his teacher brutally assaulted him for making two mistakes in an exam, a 15-year-old Dalit student of a government school in UP's Auraiya died of injuries Monday. The teacher was made to pay Rs 40,000 towards the boy's medical expenses, but has been on the run since a case was later filed against him.
articles.title: 'Assaulted' by teacher fortnight back, UP Dalit teen 'dies of injuries'

articles.description: As part of a new team set up by Maharashtra chief minister Eknath Shinde and based on the concept mooted by PM Narendra Modi to study 'best practices' in various states, Maharashtra industries minister Uday Samant and forest minister Sudhir Mungantiwar visited Gujarat on Monday.
articles.title: After losing Foxconn unit, Maharashtra sends mantris to study Gujarat model

articles.description: The Centre has issued a notification saying about 100 awards and several fellowships in science were being discontinued. Private endowment awards have been cancelled. Most departments will now have one award of "high stature".
articles.title: Govt to phase out 100 awards, several fellowships in science

articles.description: Days after the Supreme Court passed an order staying deportation of an Assam-based woman who was declared foreigner despite allegedly being born here and though all her family members including brothers, sisters and in-laws are Indian citizens, the court is facing a "deluge" of such cases.
articles.title: Facing deluge of NRC deportation cases, SC shields all petitioners

articles.description: The Centre's directive to take down a Twitter account for a particular tweet goes against Sec 69A of the IT Act and is a violation of the right to equality enshrined in Art 14, the multi-blogging platform said in the Karnataka HC on Monday. Twitter has approached the HC, challenging a series of blocking orders issued by the Centre from February 2, 2021, till Feb 28, 2022.
articles.title: Twitter challenges order to block account

articles.description: The Supreme Court Monday sought responses from the Centre and the Tamil Nadu government on a plea filed by Nalini Sriharan, serving life sentence in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case, seeking premature release.
articles.title: SC seeks govt stand on Rajiv Gandhi assassin's plea for early release

articles.description: The Supreme Court on Monday upheld the decision of the Gujarat high court quashing a criminal case filed against actor Shah Rukh Khan and others, who were booked for causing a stampede in 2017 at the Vadodara railway station while promoting his film.
articles.title: SC relief for SRK in '17 Vadodara station stampede case

articles.description: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a plea challenging a Bombay high court order directing Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) to demolish unauthorised portions of Union minister Narayan Rane's Juhu residence 'Aadhish'.
articles.title: SC refuses to stay Narayan Rane 'house' razing

articles.description: In order to address the unanticipated surge in demand for police clearance certificates (PCCs), the Union ministry of external affairs (MEA) has decided to include the facility to apply for PCC services at all online Post Office Passport Seva Kendras (POPSKs) across India, starting September 28, the government announced on Monday.
articles.title: PO passport seva kendras to help get police clearance online

articles.description: The Alimuddin Street puja was revived by local Muslims after a 16-year break last year. This time, nuns from Missionaries of Charity will join their Hindu neighbours in the carnival. A six-member all-Muslim committee is in charge here.
articles.title: Kolkata's Muslim-organised Pujas send out a message of harmony

articles.description: Unlike CUET-UG, NTA has announced subject-wise toppers for the postgraduate entrance exam. Among universities, BHU received the maximum number of 3.5 lakh applications, followed by JNU with 2.3 lakh.

articles.description: The Delhi high court on Monday refused to stay the Centre's order dismissing senior IPS officer Satish Chandra Verma a month before his scheduled retirement. Verma had assisted the CBI in its probe of the 2004 Ishrat Jahan encounter case between April 2010 and October 2011.
articles.title: Delhi HC refuses to stay dismissal of officer Satish Chandra Verma who probed Ishrat case

articles.description: Delhi's PM10 level reduced from 241g/m3 in 2017 to 196 g/m3 in 2021-22. Similarly, the PM10 level in Mumbai reduced from 151g/m3 in 2017 to 106 g/m3 in 2021-22 whereas it reduced from 119 g/m3 in 2017 to 105 g/m3 in Kolkata in 2021-22.
articles.title: Centre sets stiffer 40% air pollution reduction target for cities by 2026

articles.description: First-time Congress MLA Divya Maderna, scion of the Maderna political family, on Monday said that the condition put forth for the CLP resolution by Gehlot-loyalist MLAs was tantamount to party indiscipline.

articles.description: Foreign minister S Jaishankar publicly expressed India's displeasure over the $450 million sustainment package for Pakistan's F-16 fleet as he said Washington was "not fooling any- body" by claiming the fighter jets were meant for counter-terrorism purposes.

articles.description: The Rashtriya Indian Military College (RIMC) inducted two girls for the first time in the institution's history of over 100 years, reports Pankul Sharma. The 'July batch of 2022' began on Monday with students of Class 8, including the two girl students. Central command PRO Shantanu Pratap Singh termed it "a historic moment for the college". He said one of the girl students is from Haryana and the other is a day scholar. The decision on RIMC came after the Centre opened the doors of the NDA for women.

articles.description: Amid the power struggle in Rajasthan, a number of hoardings have come up across the city - which is CM Ashok Gehlot's hometown - that read "Naye Yug ki Taiyari (Getting ready for a new era)".

articles.description: Observing that it is a legitimate expectation of a person to get expeditious hearing on bail petition, the SC expressed its displeasure over the Bombay HC for keeping bail plea of ex-Maharashtra home minister Anil Deshmukh pending for the last six months and asked the HC to grant him a hearing during the course of the week. The SC said that HC even failed to implement its order.
articles.title: Six-month High Court delay in hearing Anil Deshmukh bail plea irks Supreme Court

articles.description: As part of a series of 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' (India75) and US-India 75th anniversary celebrations, an event to highlight the cultural heritage of indigenous tribes in Arunachal Pradesh, 'Living Heritage of Arunachal', will be held on Tuesday.

articles.description: Amid the crisis in Rajasthan, the rebuff from the Gehlot camp stands in stark contrast to the ease with which Congress replaced Amarinder Singh as the chief minister of Punjab last year, underscoring the growing belief that an ever-weakening Congress would leave the leadership vulnerable to state satraps with hold over local units.
articles.title: Why things are falling apart in Congress and centre can't hold

articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi left for Japan on Monday to participate in the state funeral of Shinzo Abe, a leader he shared a great personal rapport with. Modi will meet Abe's wife Akie Abe during his 12-16 hours stay in Japan and also hold bilateral talks with his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida.
articles.title: PM Narendra Modi to attend Shinzo Abe's funeral in Tokyo today

articles.description: The average GFR in India stood at 86.1 from 2008 to 2010 (three-year period) and has come down to 68.7 during 2018-20 (average of three years), according to the Sample Registration System (SRS) data 2020 released recently. The decline, SRS data show, has been steeper in rural areas at 20.2% compared to 15.6% in urban areas.

articles.description: Minister and Ashok Gehlot loyalist Shanti Dhariwal alleged a “100% conspiracy” against the CM by Ajay Maken and Sachin Pilot. Accusing Maken of approaching MLAs to campaign for Pilot as the next CM, Dhariwal said he had proof to back his allegation.

articles.description: Former J&K CM Ghulam Nabi Azad launched his Democratic Azad Party with a nod to the "ideals of Mahatma Gandhi" in Jammu on Monday, exactly a month to the day he quit Congress with a critique of how the grand old party he had been part of for five decades "reached the point of no return".

articles.description: Instability has come back to haunt the Congress in Rajasthan after two years. The Congress leadership’s move to replace Amarinder Singh with Charanjit Singh Channi in September last year as the Punjab CM a few months before the state poll had cost it dear. Its similar bid to change the chief minister of Rajasthan not just poses a threat to the Ashok Gehlot government but is also likely to harm the party’s prospects in the 2023 assembly election.

articles.description: "We have recently marked the Golden Jubilee of victory of 1971 war. The 1971 war will be remembered in the history as the war fought for the humanity instead of property, possession or power," Singh said."There is only one regret. The decision on PoK should have been taken at that time itself," he said.
articles.title: Decision on PoK should have been taken during 1971 Indo-Pak war: Rajnath Singh

articles.description: The ministry of information and broadcasting on Monday blocked 45 YouTube videos from 10 channels for spreading "misinformation, hate speech, and communal hatred." The content included fake news and morphed videos spread with the intent to spread hatred among religious communities.

articles.description: Congress in-charge for Rajasthan Ajay Maken on Monday accused MLAs in the Ashok Gehlot camp of “indiscipline” and said their demand setting conditions for a party resolution on picking the next chief minister was a “conflict of interest”. "In the 75 years of Congress history, there has never been a conditional resolution. Resolution is one-line only. Everything is told to the Congress president and then a decision is taken," Maken told reporters here before leaving for New Delhi.

Nalini has challenged the June 17 order of the Madras HC, which rejected her plea for early release, and cited the apex court judgment ordering the release of co-convict AG Perarivalan.

articles.description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday wished former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on his 90th birthday, and said his humility, dedication and contribution to India's development has few parallels. "Wishing one of India's finest statesman, Dr Manmohan Singh ji a very happy birthday. His humility, dedication and contribution to India's development, has few parallels," Gandhi said in a tweet.

articles.description: Ghulam Nabi Azad on Monday announced that his new political outfit will be named as 'Democratic Azad Party'. The development comes exactly a month after Azad resigned from the Congress party. Announcing the name of the new party at a press conference in Jammu, Azad said that the outfit will be secular, democratic and independent from any influence.

articles.description: With 4,129 new coronavirus infections being reported in a day, India's total tally of Covid-19 cases rose to 4,45,72,243, according to the Union health ministry data updated on Monday. The death toll climbed to 5,28,530 with 20 fresh fatalities in the last 24 hours.

articles.description: The Congress party's Bharat Jodo Yatra resumed its journey on Monday from Shornur in Kerala's Palakkad district with hundreds of party workers accompanying Rahul Gandhi in the walk. The yatra, which entered Kerala on September 10, will go through the state covering 450 km, touching seven districts before entering Karnataka on October 1.

articles.description: Uttarakhand’s sex ratio (number of females per 1,000 males) at birth was found to be the worst in the country at 844, and Kerala’s the best, at 974, according to the Sample Registration System Statistical Report 2020. The report, released by the Registrar General of India (RGI) on September 22, stated that the country’s overall sex ratio at birth had gone up by three points to 907 in 2018-20 from 904 in 2017-19.

This is contrary to the claims made by PFI that most of the Rs 120 crore it had received came through petty cash donations in India.

articles.description: If Gehlot does contest the internal polls, then many believe the message would be that the so-called revolt was actually a "fixed match" between the Central and state brass to demonstrate who among the aspirants had the acceptability to lead the party in Rajasthan. articles.description: Epidemiological studies indicate that engagement in risk reduction practices can have an impact on the incidence of dementia. A cognitive lifestyle is known to reduce the risk of dementia. Cognitive lifestyle refers to those cognitive activities that individuals perform throughout their lifespans such as young people engaging in education-based activities, adults engaging in their occupation or jobs and older adults engaging in cognitively stimulating leisure activities. By following a healthy cognitive lifestyle, one can have a good cognitive reserve. Those who have a good cognitive reserve can avoid dementia.

articles.description: Rituparna Chatterjee didn't want her childhood abuse to come in the way of her life. She wanted to be the author of her own story, not just a survivor of sexual abuse. But on the path to reclaim her life, she picked the most unexpected, perhaps even the most unusual path- she forgave her abuser. And that she says was the most selfish and self-loving choice she made. In this conversation with TOI, she explains how she found her freedom in forgiveness. To read her interview, click here
articles.title: Dealing with the trauma of sexual abuse

articles.description: RBI Monetary Policy Live Updates: The Reserve Bank's rate-setting panel on Wednesday started deliberations on the keenly awaited monetary policy amidst expectation of 50 basis points hike in interest rate to check inflation and improve foreign capital inflow to arrest declining value of rupee against the US dollar. The decision of RBI governor Shaktikanta Das headed six-member Monetary Policy Committee will be announced at 10am. Stay with TOI for all latest updates.
articles.title: LIVE: Shaktikanta Das to announce MPC statement soon

articles.description: Congress’s latest inhouse strife in Rajasthan threatens to drag beyond the AICC presidential poll, with ministers and legislators loyal to Ashok Gehlot declaring on Thursday they would rather resign and face mid-term elections than settle for a new CM “from the traitor camp”.
articles.title: Mid-term polls better than 'traitor' as CM: Ashok Gehlot camp

articles.description: A city hospital made an accidental discovery of an 8mm live roundworm wriggling in the right eye of a Buddhist monk, who was in Chennai to complete his PhD in philosophy at Madras University.
articles.title: Chennai docs remove live roundworm from monk's eye

articles.description: In a setback to the AAP government in Punjab, the Punjab and Haryana high court on Thursday restrained the state from creating any "third party interest" with regard to distribution of wheat flour (atta) to the beneficiaries at their homes.
articles.title: HC stays Punjab plan for ration home delivery

articles.description: Two explosions rocked Udhampur town within a span of eight hours since Wednesday night ahead of the three-day visit of Union home minister Amit Shah to J&K in the first week of October. Both blasts occurred in parked buses and two people were injured in the first explosion.
articles.title: Ahead of Shah's visit, twin blasts rock Udhampur

articles.description: The CBI has arrested 175 people and seized huge quantity of synthetic and traditional drugs after conducting pan-India raids in eight states.
articles.title: CBI arrests 175 across 8 states in drugs crackdown

articles.description: Emergency crews took to helicopters and boats on Thursday to rescue residents of Florida's Gulf Coast stranded by floodwaters, downed power lines and piles of debris left behind by hurricane Ian's destructive march across the state.
articles.title: Hurricane Ian devastates Florida

articles.description: A special vigilance judge on Thursday sentenced Barabati-Cuttack Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim, former IAS officer Vinod Kumar and two others to three years' rigorous imprisonment in connection with a loan scam.
articles.title: Odisha Cong MLA, ex-IAS babu get 3 yrs' RI for scam

articles.description: Barely two days before the proposed timeline for implementation of mandatory six airbags in all cars, Union road transport minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday said the new norm will be effective from October 2023, considering "global supply chain constraints" and feedback from the industry.
articles.title: 6-airbag deadline pushed back to Oct next year

articles.description: The Union home ministry has upgraded the security cover of industrialist Mukesh Ambani to the highest category of 'Z-plus' from 'Z', based on the review of his threat perception by central intelligence agencies. About 40 CRPF commandos will work in shifts to guard him, reports said.
articles.title: Govt upgrades Ambani security to 'Z-plus'

articles.description: There are two Durga Pujas with a common origin in the western suburbs. Both are celebrating their 75th anniversary.
articles.title: 2 Puja pandals in Mumbai hold 75th anniv festivities

articles.description: ​Amid rising inflation and higher fixed deposit rates, the finance ministry on Thursday announced an increase of up to 30 basis points in interest rates on certain small savings products for the next quarter, marking the first increase in nine quarters.
articles.title: Centre raises rates on some small saving plans

articles.description: Days after being recognised with the Geographical Indication (GI) tag, Warangal's famous Chapata chilli broke all records at the retail market with the cost of the spice touching Rs 900 per kg. Exclusively cultivated in Telangana's Warangal area, the chilli variety is usually priced around Rs 150 per kg.
articles.title: Chapata chilli sells for jaw-dropping Rs 900 per kg

articles.description: The discount on the base fare that Air India (AI) offers to senior citizens and students will be slashed from 50% to 25% for all bookings done from September 29, said an internal circular by the airline on Thursday, reports Manju V. The carrier will, however, continue to extend its 50% sop on base fare to other categories.
articles.title: Air India discount for sr citizens, students halved

articles.description: Uttarakhand is celebrating the appointment of Lt Gen Anil Chauhan as the new Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), and the fact that Chauhan and his predecessor, Gen Bipin Rawat, not only hail from the hill state but also come from the same district, Pauri Garhwal.
articles.title: Two villages in Pauri, hours apart, give 'back-to-back' CDS

articles.description: Uttarakhand is celebrating the appointment of Lt Gen Anil Chauhan as the new Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), and the fact that Chauhan and his predecessor, Gen Bipin Rawat, not only hail from the hill state but also come from the same district, Pauri Garhwal.
articles.title: Two villages in Pauri, hours apart, give 'back-to-back' CDS

articles.description: The Kerala HC Thursday directed the now-banned Popular Front of India (PFI) to deposit Rs 5.2 crore in two weeks to compensate for damage caused to assets of the state road transport corporation during an illegal flash strike. The division bench also ordered the state to make PFI state secretary Abdul Sattar an accused in all cases registered in the state.
articles.title: Deposit Rs 5.2cr in 2 weeks for hartal damage: HC to PFI

articles.description: The Kerala HC Thursday directed the now-banned Popular Front of India (PFI) to deposit Rs 5.2 crore in two weeks to compensate for damage caused to assets of the state road transport corporation during an illegal flash strike. The division bench also ordered the state to make PFI state secretary Abdul Sattar an accused in all cases registered in the state.
articles.title: Deposit ₹5.2cr in 2 weeks for hartal damage: HC tells PFI

articles.description: Attributing the inexorably long visa waiting period to the impact of Covid, the US embassy in Delhi said staffing should be back to 100% of pre-Covid level in less than a year.
articles.title: US embassy to add staff to cut visa wait time

articles.description: As the race was thrown open, Congress was finalising a replacement candidate for Gehlot, with Mallikarjun Kharge, a senior Dalit leader, as the lead contender.
articles.title: Gehlot out of Cong prez race, Sonia to take call on Raj CM

articles.description: After winding through parts of Kerala and Tamil Nadu over the past 22 days, Rahul Gandhi will begin the Karnataka leg of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra today. The Karnataka stretch will cover 511km over the next 21 days, but participants will take a break for four days in between over the first phase. Rahul had launched the 3,500km, 150-day campaign from Tamil Nadu’s Kanyakumari on September 7. The Karnataka leg will begin from Gundlupet in Chamarajanagar district. Rahul will kick off the march with a public speech. Stay with TOI for the latest developments --
articles.title: Live: 21-day Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra to begin today

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: Anil Chauhan will take over as the country’s next chief of defence staff (CDS) on Friday, returning to active service as a four-star genera.
articles.title: Gen Chauhan to take over as India’s next CDS on Friday

articles.description: The case was registered in the city's Raiwala police station based on a complaint filed by state Congress leader and social activist, Vijaypal Rawat, after a huge furore broke out in the state against Karnwal's comments on Wednesday.
articles.title: RSS leader booked for ‘derogatory’ FB post on Ankita's murder

articles.description: Gujarat chief minister Bhupendra Patel, governor Acharya Devvrat, Union minister Anurag Thakur and other dignitaries were present.
articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates 36th National Games in Ahmedabad

articles.description: For the first time, the Supreme Court on Thursday acknowledged the concept of ‘marital rape’, and held ‘rape’ under the MTP Act includes a husband’s act of sexual assault committed on his wife. Though another bench is to hear pleas on marital rape next February, Justice D Y Chandrachud’s observation can be seen by many as a pointer to the trajectory SC may take while deciding the prickly issue next year.
articles.title: In a first, Supreme Court recognises concept of marital rape

articles.description: Observing that artificial distinction between married and single woman for aborting unwanted pregnancy is not constitutionally sustainable, the Supreme Court on Thursday ruled that every pregnant woman, irrespective of her marital status, has the intrinsic right to choose to undergo abortion without any consent or authorization from a third party.
articles.title: 'Every pregnant woman irrespective of marital status has right to abortion'

articles.description: The Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, BSER on Thursday released the Rajasthan Eligibility Examination for Teachers, REET Result 2022. Candidates who were waiting for the the declaration of the result can now check and download REET 2022 Result from the official website.
articles.title: REET Result 2022 released; here's direct link to check

articles.description: The Popular Front of India (PFI) has been extensively using social media for recruiting youths for anti-national activities and one of the modules of the now-banned outfit even had prepared to attack foreigners, especially Jews visiting Vattakkanal, a hill station in Tamil Nadu, officials said.
articles.title: 'PFI module planned attacks on Jews visiting Tamil Nadu'

articles.description: The government on Thursday raised rates on some small savings schemes by up to 30 basis points (bps) in line with the hardening interest rate in the economy. With the revision, a three-year time deposit with post offices would earn 5.8 per cent from the existing 5.5 per cent, an increase of 30 basis points for the third quarter of the current financial year.
articles.title: Govt hikes interest rates on some small savings schemes

articles.description: After meeting Congress president Sonia Gandhi on Thursday, Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot announced that he would not contest the election for the party chief’s post. After having lost the trust of the organisation’s high command, it is also likely that he may have to wash his hands off the CM’s post.
articles.title: Will Ashok Gehlot lose Rajasthan CM’s post?

articles.description: Jeetu Gupta lost his 19-year-old son, Aayush Gupta. His co-star Rohitashv Gour and stand-up comedian, Sunil Pal took to social media to express grief on the tragic news.
articles.title: Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hain actor Jeetu Gupta's teen son passes away

articles.description: India believes US President's promise of reforming the UN Security Council is different from past Washington pledges, external affairs minister S.Jaishankar said on Wednesday, while acknowledging that the path to New Delhi's elevation in the body is still not easy and no one country can make it happen.
articles.title: It's different this time, India says about Biden promise of UN reforms

articles.description: The government had earlier issued a draft notification on January 14, 2022, and according to the draft notification the 6-airbag rule was supposed to be effective from 1 October 2022 but the domestic automotive industry had sought a re-think on the rule amid rising regulatory costs making passenger vehicles expensive.
articles.title: Cars to get costlier as six airbags mandatory for passenger cars

articles.description: The Popular Front of India (PFI) has been maintaining close ties with a radical Turkish group accused of supplying arms to al-Qaeda-affiliated jihadists in Syria and even two top leaders of the just-banned outfit were hosted by the group, officials said on Thursday.
articles.title: PFI maintaining close ties with radical Turkish group

articles.description: India’s lithium-ion battery lifecycle management firm, Lohum and Glencore, a natural resource company recently announced a strategic partnership to advance circularity in the Li-ion battery supply chain. The focus on Li-ion battery recycling is inevitable to meet the rising demand of raw material for growing EV adoption.
articles.title: Lohum to supply specialty chemicals to Glencore for Lithium-ion batteries

articles.description: The Indian batting great Virat Kohli on Thursday shared a heartwarming video for tennis legend Roger Federer and replying to his message the Swiss great thanked the Indian batter. Federer took to Instagram and said that he looks forward to come to India soon. "Thanks @ViratKohli I hope to make it to India soon," he wrote in his Instagram story.
articles.title: 'Thanks Kohli': Federer appreciates Indian batter's message

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: The suspense over what Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot will do next, culminated with him pulling out of the race for Congress preside.
articles.title: 'Sonia to decide within 2 days if Gehlot will remain CM': Key pts

articles.description: Low levels of nutrients in the body can take a drastic toll on our health. Not only does it make us feel weak and less efficient, but it can also give light to serious health problems.
articles.title: Vitamin B12 deficiency: This sign in the feet may be hard to reverse

articles.description: Bigg Boss 4 contestants Shweta Tiwari and Sameer Soni have remained close ever since their time on the show. They were seen to have a close bond, spending time together and being there for one another whenever needed. Moreover, Sameer was the only person who helped Shweta get through the difficult time she was going through as a result of Dolly Bindra's crude remarks.
articles.title: Bigg Boss 4 contestants Shweta Tiwari, Sameer Soni still bond together

articles.description: India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah was on Thursday ruled out of the T20 World Cup with a stress fracture, dealing a massive blow to the team's chances in the ICC event.
articles.title: Bumrah out of T20 World Cup, say BCCI sources

articles.description: India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah was on Thursday ruled out of the T20 World Cup with a stress fracture, dealing a massive blow to the team's chances in the ICC event.
articles.title: Bumrah out of T20 World Cup, say BCCI sources

articles.description: The government has deferred the implementation of the proposal to make six airbags mandatory in passenger cars by one year to October 1, 2023, road transport and highways minister Nitin Gadkari said on Thursday.
articles.title: Govt defers proposal to make 6 airbags mandatory in cars

articles.description: Suryakumar Yadav's status as India's best T20I batter in recent times has been reaffirmed as he became the highest scorer in a single calender year with 732 runs, surpassing Shikhar Dhawan's 689 back in 2018. Suryakumar, who scored one of his finest T20I half-centuries against South Africa on a seaming track in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday, is only 24 runs short of completing 1000 runs in the format.
articles.title: Surya becomes highest run-scorer for India in a year in T20Is

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot’s announcement that he was withdrawing from the election for the Congress president’s post provided another twist.
articles.title: Gehlot out, who else remain in race for Cong prez post

articles.description: By now, we know that COVID-19 can affect people in different ways. While some develop mild to moderate symptoms, there are those who either experience no symptoms at all or go on to battle life-threatening ailments.
articles.title: Study reveals conditions that may increase Covid death risk

articles.description: A spectacular drone show took place in Ahmedabad over the Sabarmati river ahead of the opening ceremony of the 36th National Games in Gujarat. As many as 600 drones put up the stunning show, mesmerising the crowd gathered at Sabarmati Riverfront in the city. The show was organised to honour the visit of Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the city and also to mark the opening of the National Games. The painted patterns of various messages and figures to light up the night sky- 'Welcome Hon'ble PM,' '7th Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav,' the map of India, symbolising Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel for the Statue of Unity and more. The National Games will be held from September 29 to October 12, 2022. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will officially declare the 36th National Games 2022 open on September 29, 2022. See pictures as drones put up a scintillating display.
articles.title: In pics: Drone show over Sabarmati river ahead of National Games

articles.description: The appointment of Retd Lt-Gen Anil Chauhan as India’s Chief of Defence Staff nearly 10 months after Gen Bipin Rawat died in a helicopter crash ends the vacuum that was keenly felt for several months...
articles.title: Quick Edit: New CDS must get cracking on unified commands amid Chinese aggression

articles.description: Veteran Congress leader Digvijaya Singh will file his nomination for the Congress president election on Friday. The former Madhya Pradesh chief minister, seen as being close to the Gandhi family, who arrived in Delhi on Wednesday after participating in Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala, collected nomination papers on Thursday.
articles.title: Digvijaya Singh to contest Congress president election

articles.description: Talking about the Mercedes-Benz EQS 580 4MATIC, this luxury EV will be India’s first locally manufactured luxury electric car by Mercedes Benz in India and it will also be India’s first ‘Certified locally produced luxury EV’ as per the ARAI certificate which was received by the company on 29th August 2022.
articles.title: Most expensive Made in India luxury EV launch tomorrow

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: The Congress of today is a ghost of its glorious past self.
articles.title: First among equals: Why Congress still matters more than rest of the opposition

articles.description: Naagin fame Mouni Roy has all the reasons to celebrate. After the success of Brahmastra, the actress threw a lavish birthday bash for all her industry friends. Popular celebs from the entertainment industry were in full attendance looking their glamorous best at the party. Take a look.
articles.title: Mouni dazzles in strapless white dress at birthday bash

articles.description: Dhanush and Selvaraghavan's moody thriller is let down by a tepid second half.
articles.title: Naane Varuven review: Thriller let down by tepid second half

articles.description: Tata Motors has introduced two new models in the light commercial vehicle (LCV) segment: Yodha 2.0 and Intra V50. Both pickup trucks come with improved payload capacity and enhanced driving capabilities. The Yodha 2.0 has a payload of 2000kg while the Intra V50 boasts a payload capacity of 1500kg. In this video, we show you how the vehicles look, what the cabin features are and the overall build quality. We also got a chance to drive these vehicles on an off-road track and test their driving prowess in some very challenging conditions.
articles.title: Watch: Tata Yodha 2.0 & Intra V50 off-road driving experience

articles.description: During his two-day visit to Gujarat, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday laid the foundation stone and dedicated various projects worth more than Rs 3,400 crore in Surat.
articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates development projects in Surat

articles.description: Online schooling has changed the pedagogy sphere forever for physically challenged students. The virtual solution is helping PH students to overcome the physical challenges of accessing education in traditional institutions. By providing them equitable opportunities, E-learning enables the PH student with increased engagement in class. It eliminates the jostling for space and the struggle to hear the lecture or lesson delivered by the teacher.
articles.title: Can online schooling be the best option for PH students?

articles.description: In a landmark judgment, the Supreme Court on Thursday said that marital status of a woman cannot be a ground to deprive her of the right to abort an unwanted pregnancy. The top court said that even a single and unmarried woman has the right to abort under Medical Termination of Pregnancy Act and the rules, till 24 weeks of pregnancy.
articles.title: All women entitled to safe and legal abortion, says SC

articles.description: 'Bigg Boss' is all set to return to television. This will be its 16th season. On September 27, Salman Khan, interacted with the media where he talked about the upcoming season. But did you know that Bobby Darling has been moving heaven and hell for many years to get a place in this show?
articles.title: Bigg Boss 16: Bobby Darling fails to take part despite best efforts

articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has arrived on a two-day visit in Gujarat. The PM is scheduled to visit Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Surat, Bhavnagar, and Ambaji on Thursday and Friday, where he will either lay foundation stones for development projects or dedicate them to the public. The projects are worth over Rs 30,000 crore. Stay with TOI for all the latest updates:
articles.title: Live: PM Modi holds roadshow in Surat

articles.description: Young India left-arm pacer Arshdeep Singh said "adaptability" is the main focus of the team ahead of the T20 World Cup, starting later this month in Australia. The T20 World Cup will be held in Australia from October 16 to November 13, and Arshdeep said the Indian bowlers are geared up for the tough challenge that awaits them.
articles.title: Focus is on adaptability ahead of T20 WC: Arshdeep

articles.description: Women do tend to have relative immunity to heart attacks before menopause. But in the presence of diabetes and high blood pressure which are very common in India, this protection against heart disease is blunted.
articles.title: World Heart Day: After menopause women prone to heart attack

articles.description: Coolio, the rapper who was among hip-hop's biggest names of the 1990s with hits including Gangsta's Paradise and Fantastic Voyage, died Wednesday at age 59, his manager said. Coolio died at the Los Angeles home of a friend, longtime manager Jarez Posey told The Associated Press.
articles.title: 'Gangsta's Paradise' rapper Coolio dies at 59

articles.description: Putin has said his nuclear threat isn't a bluff. His top associate, Dmitry Medvedev, said Tuesday that Russia has the right to use nuclear weapons in Ukraine if Kyiv threatens Russian statehood.
articles.title: Explainer: Just brinkmanship or will Putin really use nukes in Ukraine?

articles.description: The UP government saved over ₹8,000 crore and removed over 79 lakh ghost beneficiaries in the past nine years with the help of Aadhaar.
articles.title: How Aadhaar helped UP save Rs 8,000 cr in 9 yrs

articles.description: Check today's top 10 news stories, headline news, breaking news, latest news, politics news, sports news, entertainment news and business news on Times of India
articles.title: Top10: A substitute found for Gehlot to run against Tharoor?

articles.description: Almost two million customers were without electricity in Florida Wednesday evening out of a total of more than 11 million, with southwestern areas of the state the hardest hit, according to the PowerOutage.us tracking website.
articles.title: 2 million without power as Hurricane Ian pounds Florida

articles.description: "What I have said, to my mind represents accurate policy assessment of where the state of our relations is. We continue to strive for a relationship with China, but one that is built on mutual sensitivity, mutual respect and mutual interest," Jaishankar said during a media briefing in Washington.
articles.title: 'India strives for a relationship with China but...': Jaishankar

articles.description: On a pitch that aided prodigious swing, Suryakumar Yadav and KL Rahul's unbeaten half centuries propelled India to a convincing eight-wicket win over South Africa in a one-sided contest at the Greenfield International Stadium in Thiruvananthapuram.
articles.title: 1st T20I: India rout South Africa on a spiteful track

articles.description: Two of the three Cheetah Conservation Fund (CCF) team members who stayed back inside Kuno National Park in Sheopur district of Madhya Pradesh taking care of the eight Namibian cheetahs since they were shifted to enclosure there, finally left for their native country.
articles.title: 'Cheetahs more adapted to their new habitat now'

articles.description: The recent deaths of physically fit young Indians due to cardiac arrest have made it clear that physical fitness and healthy heart are not the same thing. People who think they are fit and do regular workouts, don’t usually complain of any problems but that doesn’t mean they are not suffering from a heart ailment. On World Heart Day 2022, we bring you details and facts about what a healthy heart means and how to overcome the fear of heart attack and cardiac arrest.
articles.title: Explained: Healthy body not equal to healthy heart

articles.description: Upset on learning that she was her husband's second wife, a 24-year-old newlywed woman hanged herself from the ceiling of her rental house at Kaveri Layout in Marathahalli on Tuesday. Gouthami took the extreme step between midnight and 4am.
articles.title: Newlywed finds she is second wife, ends life

articles.description: In a bizarre case, 63 steel spoons were found lodged in a man's stomach after doctors performed a two-hour long operation on him at a private hospital in UP's Muzaffarnagar on Tuesday.
articles.title: UP: Doctors find 63 spoons in man’s tummy

articles.description: The SC on Wednesday refused to stay the Centre's order to dismiss IPS officer Satish Chandra Verma and asked the Delhi HC to decide on the plea against his sacking expeditiously. On Verma's plea that he should be allowed to retire honourably, the bench said officers had to face tribulation for doing what they think is right and assured him that if truth is on his side then he will get justice. The HC had earlier refused relief to Verma, who is due to retire Sept 30.
articles.title: SC refuses to stay IPS officer Verma's sacking

articles.description: The city crime branch probing the case of Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) operatives, in which a man from Panch Patti locality in Kalupur was held, will investigate the honeytrap angle. Cops said that Indian phone numbers were used to lure some army jawans and obtain crucial information from them.
articles.title: Cops probe honeytrap angle in Ahmedabad

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: In a notification issued late Wednesday evening, the government has appointed senior advocate R Venkataramani as attorney general after the.
articles.title: Venkataramani appointed next attorney general

articles.description: Days after Wipro boss Rishad Premji said his company had fired 300 people for moonlighting, Hyderabad's IT sector too is taking a hard look at this vexatious issue. Companies are deploying various methods to crack down on the practice that gained currency in the work from home (WFH) era triggered by the Covid-19 pandemic.
articles.title: IT companies run checks, close in on moonlighting techies

articles.description: With the path clear for two separate Dussehra rallies to be organised by the rival Shiv Sena factions, the two sides are now in a race to outdo each other and put up a mega show of strength.
articles.title: Sena groups set for show of strength at Dussehra rallies

articles.description: The PFI first came under the radar following the involvement of its cadres in chopping a Kerala college professor's palm in 2010 over alleged blasphemy.
articles.title: What led to PFI ban

articles.description: A day after CBI arrested influential AAP functionary Vijay Nair, ED on Wednesday arrested the MD of a Delhi-based liquor company, raising the prospect of central agencies moving closer to state government functionaries in connection with the probe into the alleged corruption in the now-junked liquor policy.
articles.title: Liquor co MD held in excise probe

articles.description: The court passed the order while granting bail to an accused on medical grounds in the Rs 3,269-crore bank loan fraud case by Delhi-based Shakti Bhog Foods Ltd.
articles.title: PMLA bail terms can be eased for illness, women: HC

articles.description: T​he Cabinet on Wednesday approved Rs 10,000 crore for redevelopment of three major railway stations - New Delhi, Ahmedabad and Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus - by awarding contracts based on government funding, abandoning the earlier plan to modernise through the public private partnership route.
articles.title: New Delhi, Mum, Ahd rly stns to get 10k cr makeover

articles.description: A majority of women in West Bengal and Jharkhand were married by the age of 21, while the proportion in Jammu and Kashmir was less than 10% in 2020. In Delhi, over 17% of women married before 21. In the country as a whole, nearly 30% of women married by the time they were 21, just released government data shows.
articles.title: Majority of women in WB married by 21, only 17% in Delhi

articles.description: Among the arrested top leaders of PFI, its chairman OMA Salam is a Kerala government employee who was suspended as recently as 2020; national vice-chairman E M Abdur Rahiman a retired librarian who served in Cochin University of Science and Technology in Kalamassery.
articles.title: From techie to lecturer to govt employee: Arrested PFI men

articles.description: Gehlot arrived in the capital on Wednesday night and will meet Sonia for deliberations in the morning, talks that will have repercussions for the leadership issue as well as the CMship of Rajasthan.
articles.title: 'No drama': Rajasthan to get new CM soon, KC Venugopal says

articles.description: The US says it is considering all steps to reduce the backlog of visa applications by considering steps like interview waivers for those who previously had American visas and increasing staffing at its missions in India to their highest ever levels. The assurance came after foreign minister S Jaishankar raised the issue.
articles.title: Visa applications backlog to ease, US assures India

articles.description: A senior woman IAS officer in Bihar has kicked up a major controversy by publicly mocking a poor schoolgirl who asked if the government could provide sanitary napkins at lower prices, saying there was no end to such demands and asking if they would want 'condoms too.'

articles.description: TOI has learned that SDPI was spared as it is a registered political party, swearing allegiance to the Constitution of India. An officer said that SDPI, as long as it indulges in democratic activities by legal means, may not warrant a ban or crackdown. inside flap
articles.title: PFI's political arm SDPI spared by MHA for now, is on EC radar

articles.description: As the Congress leadership continues to grope for a candidate to support in the election for party president, Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot said the party works under its chief Sonia Gandhi and all issues will be sorted out soon. Stay with TOI for live updates --
articles.title: Live: Gehlot to meet Sonia today, says ‘issues to be sorted’

articles.description: The US will provide an additional USD 1.1 billion in aid to Ukraine, with funding for about 18 more advanced rocket systems and other weapons to counter drones that Russia has been using against Ukrainian troops, according to US officials. Stay with TOI for live updates --

articles.description: Even as the disengagement process in eastern Ladakh remains incomplete, China has claimed the phase of "emergency response" that started with the Galwan clash in June 2022 had "basically" come to an end, and that the border situation is now switching to "normalised management and control".
articles.title: Strife caused by Galwan has ended: China

articles.description: Yesterday a Court order was published which criticized late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia Khan for misusing the judicial machinery. The order stated that Rabia was trying to protract the trial by repeatedly filing applications in various courts despite the fact that the CBI had submitted a report confirming that Jiah's death was by suicide and not homicide, as alleged by Rabia. In light of this order, ETimes reached out to the main accused, Sooraj Pancholi's mother Zarina Wahab. Here is the conversation that took place...
articles.title: Zarina Wahab: Sooraj Pancholi is innocent and Rabia Khan knows it - Exclusive

articles.description: An unidentified assailant masquerading as a patient shot and killed a Chinese national and wounded two others in their seventies inside a dentist's clinic in the southern Pakistan port city of Karachi on Wednesday, five months after a suicide attack there left three Chinese dead.
articles.title: Karachi: Posing as patient, gunman kills Chinese

articles.description: A court in Bihar's Begusarai on Wednesday issued arrest warrants against Ekta Kapoor, film producer and director, and her mother Shobha Kapoor on charges of insulting soldiers and hurting the sentiments of their family members in her web series 'XXX' (Season-2). The court of judge Vikas Kumar issued the warrant on the basis of a complaint lodged by Shambhu Kumar, an ex-serviceman and a resident of Begusarai.
articles.title: Bihar court issues arrest warrant against Ekta Kapoor

articles.description: The Central government on Wednesday appointed senior advocate R Venkataramani as the new Attorney General of India for a period of three years. Venkataramani is one of the top lawyers in the country and has dealt in matters as varied as constitutional law, environmental law, taxation, tribal rights, and child and women’s rights.

articles.description: There has been a ruckus in UP over incidents of pet dogs biting people. On the other hand, Kanpur Municipal Corporation has taken a tough decision because of the increasing attacks. Kanpur Municipal Corporation has passed a resolution banning the rearing of dangerous dogs like pitbull, American bully, and rottweilers. As per the resolution, anyone found rearing either of these breeds will be fined up to Rs 5,000 and their pet will be confiscated. Along with this, If someone has a dog of this breed, then he will have to give an affidavit that if this dog bites someone, then a case will be registered against the owner.As few days ago, a dog of the Pitbull breed attacked the cow. Amid many such incidents, the Kanpur Municipal Corporation has taken this tough decision.
articles.title: Kanpur civic body bans Pitbull & Rottweiler dog breeds

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: Lt General Anil Chauhan (Retired) was on Wednesday named India's new Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), the top military post which aims to brin.

articles.description: Lt General Anil Chauhan (Retired) has been appointed as the Chief of Defence Staff (CDS), nearly 10 months after the death of CDS General Bipin Rawat in a helicopter crash.As CDS, Lt Gen Chauhan will function as secretary to government of India, department of military affairs, the defence ministry said.Born on May 18, 1961, Lt Gen Anil Chauhan was commissioned into the 11 Gorkha Rifles of the Indian Army in 1981.
articles.title: Lt General Anil Chauhan (Retired) named India's new Chief of Defence Staff

articles.description: The Popular Front of India (PFI) on Wednesday announced the disbanding of the organisation hours after the Centre banned the PFI and its associate outfits. "All PFI members & public are informed that the Popular Front of India (PFI) has been dissolved. MHA has issued a notification banning PFI. As law-abiding citizens of our great country, the organisation accepts the decision," says Kerala state general secretary of PFI Abdul Sattar said in a statement.
articles.title: PFI dissolves organisation after Centre announces ban

articles.description: The Congress is facing rebellion while replacing Ashok Gehlot as the Rajasthan chief minister. The change of guard in Punjab last year, coincidentally in September itself, was also not without internal rumblings. In contrast, the BJP has replaced as many as six CMs in five states in less than two years and all such transitions have been peaceful and smooth. In fact, the BJP CMs who were removed felt “humbled” and thanked the party leadership for giving them an opportunity to serve the organisation and their respective states.
articles.title: Rajasthan crisis: How BJP, Cong CMs reacted to getting replaced

articles.description: Madhya Pradesh Congress chief Kamal Nath on Wednesday said he does not want to contest the election for the post of party chief because he wishes to focus on the state assembly elections scheduled next year. Addressing a press conference, the former Madhya Pradesh chief minister said that the elections for the Congress president's post are being held because Rahul Gandhi refused to take up the party's reins.

articles.description: Days after a pan-India crackdown on the Popular Front of India (PFI) for alleged terror activities, the government has banned the group over its terror links.  A large number of its operatives have been arrested in nationwide raids on the group by the NIA and the ED under 'Operation Lotus'.  The government has said that overtly the group and its affiliates operate as a socio-economic, educational and political organization but in reality they have been pursuing a secret agenda to radicalize a particular section of the society. But how did the outfit that had its roots in the Kerala-based National Development Front which was formed in 1993 reach here? The crackdown against PFI has raised several questions over a possible countrywide ban. Watch the video to know more.
articles.title: Govt bans PFI: How its terror links were unearthed

articles.description: "PFI and its associates or affiliates or fronts operate openly as a socio-economic, educational and political organization but, they have been pursuing a secret agenda to radicalize a particular section of the society working towards undermining the concept of democracy," said the government notification. articles.description: Gautam Adani said China will feel increasingly isolated as rising nationalism, shifts in supply chains and technology curbs threaten the world’s second-biggest economy. China’s Belt and Road Initiative has run into resistance in many countries, challenging Beijing’s global ambitions, the world’s third-richest man told a conference in Singapore on Tuesday.

articles.description: With flowers, prayers and a 19-gun salute, Japan honoured slain former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe on Tuesday at the first state funeral for a former premier in 55 years - a ceremony that has become as controversial as he was in life. A moment of silence was followed by a retrospective of Abe's political life and speeches by leading ruling party figures.
articles.title: With flowers and gun salute, Japan bids farewell to Abe

articles.description: Distance Learning needn’t be difficult anymore as more and more educators are using online tools to enhance their wards’ e-learning experience. The Covid-19 pandemic in 2020 forced almost everyone around the globe to adapt and relook at the existing systems of work and performance differently. Irrespective of the sector one was a part of, everyone was affected and age group notwithstanding, each one was expected to adapt to a new changed environment virtually overnight.
articles.title: Check out online tools that enhance e-Learning experience

articles.description: Soon after the Congress’s Bharat Jodo Yatra was launched on September 7, the party has been accusing its rival BJP of “headline management” in a bid to divert the people’s attention from the ambitious programme. However, the political crisis in Rajasthan following the defiance by MLAs loyal to chief minister Ashok Gehlot has robbed the party of this accusation.
articles.title: How Raj crisis robs Cong of claims about Bharat Jodo Yatra

articles.description: A Delhi Police team took two actresses inside the Tihar jail to "recreate" their alleged meeting with conmon Sukesh Chandrashekhar as part of a probe into a Rs 200-crore extortion case, officials said on Monday. The police said ever since Chandrasherkar has been jailed, the prison had become a hub of illegal activities which he carried out with the help of jail officials.

articles.description: This year seems to be the most difficult one for the sports community across the world as several ace players have announced their retirement. While in the world of tennis, it's Serena Williams and Roger Federer, in cricket, it's legendary Indian pacer Jhulan Goswami who has put an end to her cricketing career. Goswami played her final international match for the country against England at Lord's on September 24, 2022. Skipper Harmanpreet Kaur, vice-captain and superstar opener Smriti Mandhana paid their tributes during her farewell as India women beat England by 16 runs in the 3rd and final ODI. Goswami also received a Guard of Honor from the England players as she walked out to bat one final time during the match. Taking to social media, she penned an emotional retirement post expressing her gratitude towards everyone who was a part of her journey. "To my cricket family and beyond. So, the day has finally arrived! Like every journey has an end, my cricket journey of over 20 years ends today as I announce my retirement from all forms Of cricket. As Ernest Hemingway said, `It is good to have an end to journey toward, but it is the journey that matters in the end. For me, this journey has been the most satisfying. It has been exhilarating, thrilling to say the least adventurous. I have had the honour of donning the India jersey for over two decades and serving my country to the best of my abilities. There is a sense of pride every time I hear the National Anthem before a match," she wrote. Here, we bring you pictures from Goswami's final match.
articles.title: Pictures from Jhulan Goswami's last match

articles.description: Navratri is one of the major Hindu festivals that is celebrated with much enthusiasm in India as well as by the Hindu community abroad. Devotees, during this time, visit famous Durga temples across the country to pray to Maa Shakti (a form of Goddess Durga).This is also the time when people flock to different Shakti Peethas and the temples dedicated to the nine forms of Durga that are spread throughout the Indian subcontinent. On that note, let’s have a look at nine revered temples dedicated to Goddess’s nine different forms:
articles.title: Temples dedicated to nine Durga avatars

articles.description: An electric drivetrain has less moving parts as all the  complicated oily bits such as the engine, fuel lines and tank get replaced by an electric motor, controller and battery pack. However, manufacturers need to check periodically that all present systems are at optimum performance levels. The main components for service and inspection are the electric motor(s), battery pack and thermal cooling system.
articles.title: Car service once every two years! Mercedes-Benz EQS sets new standard for EVs

articles.description: World Tourism Day: 10 trends that are here to stay. September 27, 2022, is the 42nd edition of World Tourism Day. This year, it will be hosted by Bali, Indonesia. The official theme for this year is 'Rethinking Tourism'. This year’s theme focuses on the future of tourism. After a major global setback due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the tourism sector is on its path to recovery and it is time we rethink how we do tourism. This is to call every stakeholder for a more sustainable, inclusive and resilient sector. More on Times Travel.
articles.title: Wolrd Tourism Day: 10 trends that would stay for long

articles.description: The Supreme Court on Tuesday started livestreaming of hearings.  The apex court had on Monday said it would have its own 'platform' to live-stream proceedings and the use of YouTube for the purpose was temporary. In a unanimous decision, the court decided to live-stream proceedings of all constitution bench hearings, almost four years after a path-breaking verdict in this regard was delivered.
articles.title: Supreme Court begins livestreaming of hearings

articles.description: In terms of driving experience, it is a very smooth car to drive and it starts in electric mode. You can drive it powered by battery only up to a certain speed though. Also, one needs to be gentle with the throttle to stay in EV mode but if you're going to use the throttle generously, the engine will have to kick in and support the propulsion.

articles.description: The galactic slam occurred at a harmless asteroid 7 million miles (9.6 million kilometers) away, with the spacecraft named Dart plowing into the space rock at 14,000 mph (22,500 kph). Scientists expected the impact to carve out a crater, hurl streams of rocks and dirt into space and, most importantly, alter the asteroid's orbit.
articles.title: Bam! NASA spacecraft crashes into asteroid in defense test

articles.description: Former President APJ Abdul Kalam could have been saved had someone in the audience at the Indian Institute of Management-Shillong performed cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) when he suddenly collapsed while delivering a lecture, said professor Aditya Kapoor, head of cardiology department at the Sanjay Gandhi Postgraduate Institute of Medical Sciences (SGPGIMS) on Monday.

articles.description: Shedding its usual practice of adopting a liberal approach, especially with regard to senior lawyers who are unable to appear on many occasions due to engagements in other cases, the Supreme Court on Monday made it clear that hearings would not be deferred as it asked a senior advocate not to embarrass the bench by asking for adjournment.

articles.description: Even as Congress termed the boycott by MLAs close to Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot "gross indiscipline", it is learned that the party is scrambling to salvage the situation and has reached out to the state leadership. articles.description: Delhi's PM10 level reduced from 241g/m3 in 2017 to 196 g/m3 in 2021-22. Similarly, the PM10 level in Mumbai reduced from 151g/m3 in 2017 to 106 g/m3 in 2021-22 whereas it reduced from 119 g/m3 in 2017 to 105 g/m3 in Kolkata in 2021-22.

articles.description: The Rashtriya Indian Military College (RIMC) inducted two girls for the first time in the institution's history of over 100 years, reports Pankul Sharma. The 'July batch of 2022' began on Monday with students of Class 8, including the two girl students. Central command PRO Shantanu Pratap Singh termed it "a historic moment for the college". He said one of the girl students is from Haryana and the other is a day scholar. The decision on RIMC came after the Centre opened the doors of the NDA for women.
articles.title: In a first, 2 girls inducted into RIMC

articles.description: Observing that it is a legitimate expectation of a person to get expeditious hearing on bail petition, the SC expressed its displeasure over the Bombay HC for keeping bail plea of ex-Maharashtra home minister Anil Deshmukh pending for the last six months and asked the HC to grant him a hearing during the course of the week. The SC said that HC even failed to implement its order.

articles.description: The average GFR in India stood at 86.1 from 2008 to 2010 (three-year period) and has come down to 68.7 during 2018-20 (average of three years), according to the Sample Registration System (SRS) data 2020 released recently. The decline, SRS data show, has been steeper in rural areas at 20.2% compared to 15.6% in urban areas.
articles.title: Fertility rate declined by 20% in India in 10 years: SRS data

articles.description: Researchers have made the most thorough assessment to date of the global population of ants - insects that have colonized almost everywhere on the planet - and the estimated total is a mind-blowing 20 quadrillion of them, or approximately 2.5 million for every human.

articles.description: LML (Lohia Machines Limited) is all set to make a comeback into the Indian market next year as an EV firm, called LML Electric. Moreover, the company is planning to raise Rs 500 crore funding to set up its manufacturing plant across the country.

articles.description: Instability has come back to haunt the Congress in Rajasthan after two years. The Congress leadership’s move to replace Amarinder Singh with Charanjit Singh Channi in September last year as the Punjab CM a few months before the state poll had cost it dear. Its similar bid to change the chief minister of Rajasthan not just poses a threat to the Ashok Gehlot government but is also likely to harm the party’s prospects in the 2023 assembly election.
articles.title: Congress president election: Is Rajasthan going the Punjab way?

articles.description: Employers are likely to raise staff pay by 10.4% next year, almost on par with the 10.6% so far in 2022, Aon PLC said on Monday. The prospects of a double-digit salary increase comes as India grapples with soaring inflation amid fears of a global economic slowdown.
