articles.description: India beat Australia by six wickets in the third and final T20 International to clinch the three-match series 2-1. Cameron Green and Tim David scored the bulk of runs as Australia put 186 for 7 after being invited to bat. Chasing the target 187, India won the match after impressive performances by Virat Kohli who scored 63 runs and Suryakumar Yadav who scored 69 runs at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium, Hyderabad. The victory marked India's 21st T20I win in 2022 out of 28 matches. With this, Team India surpassed their arch-rivals Pakistan's record, who had previously held the record of 20 T20I wins in 2021. The victory against Australia also marked Rohit Sharma's 33rd win as India's T20I captain, putting him ahead of Kohli. The Indian team has had four captains in T20s this year with Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant leading the side. Post the win, Rohit shared a few pictures on social media and captioned it as, "CHARACTER 🇮�🇳�." India will next face South Africa in a three-match T20I series, beginning on September 28, 2022.
articles.title: In pics: India wins T20 Int'l series against Aus

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: Legislators and ministers loyal to Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot quite en masse on late Sunday ahead of a scheduled Congress legisl.
articles.title: Gehlot told to ensure 'discipline' amid MLAs' revolt

articles.description: On Monday evening, a robotic Nasa spacecraft is programmed to ram itself into a distant asteroid at 14,000 miles per hour (25,500 kilometers per hour) in deep space to demonstrate the agency’s future ability to defend Earth from hazardous space rocks.
articles.title: How Nasa plans to avoid future catastrophes on Earth

articles.description: Ghulam Nabi Azad on Monday announced that his new political outfit will be named as 'Democratic Azad Party'. The development comes exactly a month after Azad resigned from the Congress party. Announcing the name of the new party at a press conference in Jammu, Azad said that the outfit will be secular, democratic and independent from any influence.
articles.title: Ghulam Nabi Azad announces name of his new party

articles.description: Maruti Suzuki today launched its newest flagship offering from NEXA, the Grand Vitara SUV at a starting price of Rs 10.45 lakh (ex-showroom). The Grand Vitara price ranges between Rs. 10.45 lakh to 17.05 lakh (both prices are ex-showroom). It will be available in 10 variants, with 3 dual-tone and 6 monotone colour options, including the Nexa Blue.
articles.title: Maruti Grand Vitara launched: Variant-wise prices explained

articles.description: India went seven points clear of England at the top of the ICC T20 rankings following their narrow series win over Australia in Hyderabad. Down 0-1 against the touring Australia, the Rohit Sharma-led India bounced back in style to level the series in Nagpur before Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav's fifties in the deciding rubber on Sunday sealed a 2-1 win.
articles.title: T20I Rankings: India go 7 points clear of England at top

articles.description: Jacqueline Fernandez has been summoned by the Delhi High Court today for the Sukesh Chandrashekhar extortion case. While updates around her appearance in Court are still coming in, ETimes was able to get an update from her lawyer Prashant Patil. The senior lawyer revealed, "Jacqueline has been granted interim bail. This appearance is mere procedural. The next date to appear before the Court is October 22. "
articles.title: Jacqueline Fernandez granted interim bail, confirms lawyer

articles.description: Malayalam filmmaker Ashokan aka Raman Ashok Kumar passed away on Sunday (Sep 25). He was 60.
articles.title: Malayalam filmmaker Ashokan passes away

articles.description: Virat Kohli on Sunday surpassed Rahul Dravid to become the second highest run-scorer for India in international cricket. The star batter accomplished this feat in the third T20I against Australia in Hyderabad. In the match, the 'Chase Master' Kohli was in full flow, switching from attacker to anchor, from anchor to attacker at will. He struck 63 runs in 48 balls, consisting of three fours and four sixes. His strike rate was also pretty solid at 131.25.
articles.title: Kohli becomes India's 2nd highest run-scorer in int'l cricket

articles.description: Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 16 is slated to premiere on October 1. With just a few days left, the buzz around the contestants of the show has now gotten stronger. The latest is that actor Gautam Singh Vig is going to be a part of the controversial reality show.
articles.title: Bigg Boss 16: Gautam Vij is first confirmed contestant

articles.description: Just as we were heaving a sigh of relief with the World Health Organisation (WHO) Chief's statement that the COVID pandemic's end is in sight, a new COVID-like virus has been found.
articles.title: Covid-like virus, Khosta 2, found in Russian bats

articles.description: Neha Kakkar and Falguni Pathak shot an episode and shared the Indian Idol 13 stage marking the beginning of Navratri festival. In a video shared by the channel, Neha welcomes Falguni to kickstart garba night in the singing reality show.
articles.title: Indian Idol 13: Neha Kakkar welcomes Falguni Pathak in the show

articles.description: India skipper Rohit Sharma wants to give wicketkeeper batter Dinesh Karthik more time in the middle before the team heads Down Under for the T20 World Cup next month. Indian have been alternating between Karthik and Rishabh Pant in their playing XI. While the young keeper was given the nod ahead of the veteran player in the Asia Cup, Karthik was picked for all three matches against Australia.
articles.title: Want to give DK more game time ahead of WC: Rohit

articles.description: Suryakumar Yadav on Sunday became the leading run-scorer in T20I cricket of 2022. The star Indian T20I batter accomplished this feat during his side's third T20I match against Australia. During the match, Suryakumar played a hard-hitting knock of 69 runs in just 36 balls. His inning was decorated with five delightful boundaries and five big sixes. He struck the ball at an impressive strike rate of 191.67.
articles.title: Suryakumar becomes leading run-scorer in T20Is in 2022

articles.description: Check today's top 10 news stories, headline news, breaking news, latest news, politics news, sports news, entertainment news and business news on Times of India
articles.title: Times Top10: Shivaji Park and Sena's politics

articles.description: In a significant development with a potential for increasing the income of farmers and providing employment to youths staying in rural parts of Uttar Pradesh, the Yogi government on Sunday approved the first winery in the state. It will come up in Muzaffarnagar.
articles.title: Muzaffarnagar to get UP’s first winery

articles.description: The new parking system introduced at the Chandigarh railway station has come under criticism, with a Sector 52 resident shooting off a complaint to the Prime Minister after he was charged Rs 1,000 for 60 minutes.
articles.title: Rs 1,000 for 60 minutes: Complaint to PM on new parking system at Chandigarh rly stn

articles.description: Chief minister Mamata Banerjee has slammed BJP in the festive issue of party mouthpiece ‘Jago Bangla’ for spreading hatred and lies even surrounding a festival like Durga Puja, an epitome of inclusiveness and communal harmony.
articles.title: BJP spreading hatred, lies even over Durga Puja: Didi

articles.description: India captain Rohit Sharma on Sunday admitted that death bowling remains an area of concern for the team going into next month's T20 World Cup but hoped that the bowlers will find their groove soon. Both Harshal Patel and Jasprit Bumrah are returning after a long injury lay-off, while Bhuvneshwar Kumar too has erred in the back end.
articles.title: There are lot of areas for improvement: Rohit

articles.description: New Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara 2022 launch in India Live Updates: Maruti Suzuki India is all set to launch the much anticipated Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara SUV to the Indian market in just a few hours from now. When launched, the SUV competes with Kia Seltos, Hyundai Creta, Skoda Kushaq, Volkswagen Taigun, Nissan Kicks, Tata Harrier and the MG Astor.
articles.title: Live: Maruti Suzuki Grand Vitara 2022 launch

articles.description: CUET PG Result 2022 LIVE Updates: The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the CUET-PG Result 2022. Candidates can now visit the official website to check and download their results. However, the result was delayed. M Jagadesh Kumar, Chairman of University Grants Commission (UGC) took to Twitter on Sunday to announce the CUET-PG 2022 result time and date. Stay with the Times of India for all the latest updates on CUET-PG 2022 result, scorecard and admission process.
articles.title: Live: CUET PG results declared

articles.description: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Indices fell on Monday in broadbased selling, tracking Asian peers, as investors shunned equities on renewed worries over economic growth in the face of a high-interest rate environment. Stay with TOI for all latest updates.
articles.title: Live: Sensex crashes 900 points

articles.description: As many as seven people were killed and 10 others suffered injuries as a tempo traveller fell into a gorge in Kullu district of Himachal Pradesh on Sunday evening.
articles.title: 7 dead, 10 injured as tempo traveller falls into gorge in Kullu

articles.description: News from India and across the world, as it unfolds. Stay with TOI for all updates
articles.title: Live: Ghulam Nabi Azad announces name of his party

articles.description: India is set to manufacture Apple’s flagship iPhone 14 smartphones with the company confirming that the devices would be made at contract-manufacturer Foxconn’s factory in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu. This would perhaps be the quickest scale-up that Apple has initiated in its India manufacturing setup with the latest iPhone being made here within weeks of its global unveiling on September 7.
articles.title: Apple to make iPhone 14 in India

articles.description: India is set to manufacture Apple’s flagship iPhone 14 smartphones with the company confirming that the devices would be made in India at contract-manufacturer Foxconn’s factory in Sriperumbudur, Tamil Nadu. This would perhaps be the quickest scale-up that Apple has initiated in its India manufacturing setup with the latest iPhone being made here within weeks of its global unveiling on September 7.
articles.title: Foxconn to make iPhone 14 in India

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday announced the decision to rename Chandigarh airport after Shaheed Bhagat Singh.
articles.title: PM: Chandigarh airport to be named after Bhagat Singh

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI/PATNA: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and RJD patriarch Lalu Prasad on Sunday met Congress president Sonia Gandhi to discuss the contours of oppositi.
articles.title: Lalu, Nitish meet Sonia, more talks post Congress poll

articles.description: RSS has already been involved in primary and higher secondary education and now wants to focus on institutions of higher education through their organisation Uchch Shiksha Sansthan. It has already opened Chanakya University in Bengaluru on a sprawling campus of 125 acres last year, while another in Guwahati is in the offing.
articles.title: RSS to start five universities for ‘positive change’

articles.description: Within days of releasing the draft telecom bill for public comments, the government has received feedback that penal provisions for violation of norms on privacy of users need to be tightened further. These are expected to be incorporated when the final legislation is drafted.
articles.title: Telecom privacy violators set to face stiff penalties

articles.description: Bengaluru-based gaming firm Gameskraft Technology has been accused of not paying GST of Rs 21,000 crore between 2017 and June 30, 2022. Gameskraft now has the dubious distinction of being charged by the Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) with the largest indirect tax show-cause notice in history, according to reports.
articles.title: Gaming firm faces biggest GST notice of Rs 21k cr

articles.description: A Bidhannagar police team on Sunday rescued 18 youths - each aged between 18 and 25 - from the Kolkata airport, who had been held captive and tortured for over a month by members of a racket, which had promised them jobs in the US, but were extorting their families for lakhs in exchange for their return.
articles.title: Kolkata: Cops bust torture-extort 'US jobs' racket

articles.description: As 55 men, women and children landed in Delhi, the number of those from the Sikh community remaining in Afghanistan number just a little over 40 with most of them staying back to protect and care for the "Guru Granth Sahib" amid the ongoing impasse with the Taliban regime which has refused to allow the religious scriptures to be taken out citing them to be the heritage of Afghanistan.
articles.title: 55 Afghan Sikhs, Hindus reach Delhi by special flight

articles.description: India News: NEW DELHI : PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that for the first time in the country, sign language is being included as a subject in academic curriculu.
articles.title: In a 1st, sign language made part of curriculum: Modi

articles.description: Uttarakhand’s sex ratio (number of females per 1,000 males) at birth was found to be the worst in the country at 844, and Kerala’s the best, at 974, according to the Sample Registration System Statistical Report 2020. The report, released by the Registrar General of India (RGI) on September 22, stated that the country’s overall sex ratio at birth had gone up by three points to 907 in 2018-20 from 904 in 2017-19.
articles.title: At 844, sex ratio at birth worst in Uttarakhand

articles.description: India News: AHMEDABAD: The treatment for cancer, which often goes on for years, drains the families of the patient mentally and takes a toll on their finances.
articles.title: Cancer medicines may get cheaper: Indian UICC president

articles.description: An increase of 50 basis points (100bps = 1 percentage point) in interest rates by the monetary policy committee (MPC) of the RBI is seen as inevitable by economists in the wake of the 75bps hike by the US Fed. The subsequent pressure on the rupee has made it more likely that the domestic central bank would increase rates too this Friday.
articles.title: RBI may hike rates by 50bps at this week's policy meet

articles.description: Popular Front of India (PFI) officebearers, many of whom have been in detention, used Abu Dhabi’s Darbar restaurant as the den for all hawala transactions and their illegal transfer to India, ED has said. This is contrary to the claims made by PFI that most of the Rs 120 crore it had received came through petty cash donations in India.
articles.title: PFI used Abu Dhabi restaurant as hub for hawala deals: ED

articles.description: If Gehlot does contest the internal polls, then many believe the message would be that the so-called revolt was actually a "fixed match" between the Central and state brass to demonstrate who among the aspirants had the acceptability to lead the party in Rajasthan. But if Gehlot backs out, then it would be seen as a genuine revolt whereby the state leadership virtually seceded from the already weakened high command, and refused to accept its writ.
articles.title: Real revolt or fixed match? Raj Cong unit keeps all guessing

articles.description: The family of 19-year-old Ankita Bhandari, whose brutal murder rocked Uttarakhand, cremated her body in Srinagar in Pauri Garhwal on Sunday evening. Earlier on Sunday, Ankita’s father refused to cremate her body, demanding the full post-mortem examination report.  ​​The post-mortem examination was conducted on Saturday by a panel of doctors from AIIMS, Rishikesh.
articles.title: Ankita cremated: 'Razing part of resort erased key evidence’

articles.description: Legislators and ministers loyal to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot made a beeline for the assembly speaker’s residence late Sunday to resign en masse ahead of a scheduled CLP meeting, seeking to preempt the possibility of the Congress high command from picking his bete noire Sachin Pilot for chief ministership. Cabinet minister Pratap Singh Khachariyawas said 92 of Congress' 108 MLAs were at speaker CP Joshi’s door.
articles.title: Rajasthan political crisis: In bid to block Pilot, Gehlot camp MLAs quit en masse

articles.description: An INLD-organised rally in Haryana’s Fatehabad on Sunday that was meant to be the stage for prominent non-BJP faces to find common ground saw a clutch of opposition parties skip the event, leaving Bihar CM Nitish Kumar, Sharad Pawar and a handful of others to peddle a “mahagathbandhan” as the panacea for the 2024 poll challenge.
articles.title: Nitish, Pawar, Badal at Haryana rally, but many skip

articles.description: India can scale up production of the indigenous Tejas light combat aircraft to meet operational requirements and export orders, defence ministry officials said. The single-engine Tejas fighter is already the frontrunner to bag a Malaysian order for 18 light twin-seat fighter trainers despite strong competition from Chinese JF-17, South Korean FA-50 and Russian MiG-35 and Yak-130 jets.
articles.title: 'Can scale up output of Tejas fighters for exports, operational needs'

articles.description: Varsha Barma exclusively shares her journey on winning the trophy of DID Super Moms 3.
articles.title: Winner of DID Super Moms 3 Varsha Bumra, a labourer from Haryana

articles.description: It all boiled down to the last three overs. The Australians, who were 140 for six at the end of the 17th overs, had got 46 in the final three. The Indians, who had set the chase up very nicely needing just 32 for a series win, overcame some spirited fightback to post a thumping six-wicket win in the third and final T20I match.
articles.title: 3rd T20I: Yadav, Kohli power India to a 6-wicket win in series decider

articles.description: High drama unfolded in Rajasthan on Sunday evening as a group of Congress MLAs loyal to chief minister Ashok Gehlot reached the assembly speaker's residence to submit their resignation ahead of a legislature party meeting which was called to decide on his successor. Stay with TOI for live updates
articles.title: Live: 'Told Sonia to pick whoever can help retain Rajasthan'

articles.description: The life of TV celebrities isn't as easy as it looks, they often go through a lot of ups and downs in their career as well as their health. It is not always that all celebrities are in their prime and in proper health all the time. A look at some of the TV celebs who came forward and talked about their health issues in public.
articles.title: These TV celebs were vocal about their mental, physical health issues

articles.description: India has reported 4,129 new Covid cases, while the active cases declined to 43,415, according to the Union health ministry data updated on Monday. The death toll climbed to 5,28,530 with 20 fatalities. Stay with TOI for all live updates
articles.title: Live: India logs 4,129 new Covid cases, 20 deaths in 24 hours

articles.description: Russian forces launched new strikes on Ukrainian cities as Kremlin-orchestrated votes took place in occupied regions of Ukraine to create a pretext for their annexation by Moscow. Meanwhile, the TASS news agency reported on Saturday that the Duma, Russia’s lower house of parliament, may debate bills incorporating Russian-occupied parts of Ukraine into Russia on September 29. Stay with TOI for all updates
articles.title: Live: 9 killed after shots fired at school in central Russia

articles.description: The Times of a Better India News: There is something eerie about a camouflaged, almost invisible, predator that leaves a trail of blood and destruction.
articles.title: Tigers back in north Andhra after 25 years, strike fear
